intro: Trichinium drummondii var. decoloratum, commonly known as the pale trichinium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a bluish-green hue, while the flowers are small and white or pale yellow. The variety decoloratum is distinguished by its reduced pigmentation compared to the typical form of Trichinium drummondii.
